page.title: 10GOSFORTH SHOPPING CENTRE
page.content:
In 1980 they opened the Gosforth Shopping centre. It was made from bricks outside and marble inside. There are shops on the ground floor and a car park on the top floor and lifts joining the two. In the middle there is an atrium with a glass roof and fountains and plants. Because it is covered it needs lights on all day. At night all the centre is closed.
Most people go to Presto which is a supermarket. Because most people shop in the supermarket other shops had to close down. There are shops called Boots, Martins, Northern Rock, a Post Office and Radio Rentals. There are two bakers, a butcher, a greengrocer and a freezer shop.
